raw_data.context:
User: Hi!
System: hello
User: how is the youtube video creation going?
System: going pretty good, I was about to finish composing my second song and post it on youtube/soundcloud etc
User: Whoa! Looking forward to listening to it. What softewares you use for it?
System: I used logic pro x, pretty handy stuff as you can write code to generate guitar strumming pattern
User: oh cool! What sort of music do you compose?
System: I got most inspired by Jazz and electro swings, but am trying to get more into jpop recently as one of my band member likes anime
User: Nice.... you are a rockstar! ;)
System: haha thanks, do you plan any instruments?
User: Yeah.... I play bit of guitar. Just got my first monitor this week
System: nice I'm tyring to learn guitar recently also, it's so hard to play f chord
User: yes, the bar chords are the worst. It took me several months to play them well. I still can't play them for a long time though
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hello
User: how is the youtube video creation going?
System: going pretty good, I was about to finish composing my second song and post it on youtube/soundcloud etc
User: Whoa! Looking forward to listening to it. What softewares you use for it?
System: I used logic pro x, pretty handy stuff as you can write code to generate guitar strumming pattern
User: oh cool! What sort of music do you compose?
System: I got most inspired by Jazz and electro swings, but am trying to get more into jpop recently as one of my band member likes anime
User: Nice.... you are a rockstar! ;)
System: haha thanks, do you plan any instruments?
User: Yeah.... I play bit of guitar. Just got my first monitor this week
System: nice I'm tyring to learn guitar recently also, it's so hard to play f chord
User: yes, the bar chords are the worst. It took me several months to play them well. I still can't play them for a long time though

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how are you doing today?
User: I heard they are giving out some goodies in microkitchen.
System: I love pop ups! What kind of goodies are they giving away?
User: I guess its a jacket! Very much needed that in the cold :)
System: That's such a great idea, especially at this time of the year. I'm not too big a fan of the cold. I prefer warmer climates. Do you enjoy the cold?
User: Sure hate it! Limits our ability to go out even for a walk! Its good that we don't get to suffer extreme cold weather!
System: Me too! I moved here a few years ago to get out of the extreme cold. I do not care for bundling up and having to wear so many layers just to go buy eggs at the store.
User: Oh nice! Where did you live before?
System: Upstate New York. We got a foot of snow every week during my last winter there. I am so glad to not have to shovel snow now
User: New york! Nice! Best place to live :) .. right, except for the cold!
System: Very beautiful during all the seasons but yes, summer and winter can get extreme!
User: Anyways, i guess we should better hurry up to get the goodies. I remember last time they ran out of it.

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how's it going?
User: All good! It's cold
System: It's pretty cold here too.
User: where do you stay?
System: Wisconsin. How about you?
User: San Jose, Cali
System: Oh nice! I've always wanted to go to Cali.
User: Have you been here before?

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?
User: Not much, Monday morning, a new week
System: The best kind of week!
User: I like that attitude
System: And I like your attitude. How's your week going?
User: Starting now
System: Awesome! I hope you have an awesome week!
User: What will you do this week?
System: Same as every week. Do nothing!
User: Would you like to do something?
System: Sure. What do you have in mind?
User: Teach me something new
System: It's a trap! I'm already doing nothing!
User: How about doing politics? You can still do nothing
System: That's why I plan to do nothing at the weekend!
User: Do you vote?
System: When I feel like it.
User: whom do you vote?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How is your friday going
System: Pretty good thanks How about you?
User: Good enough. WHat's for lunch
System: Glad to hear it. . I'm having kebabs.
User: are those your hands?
System: I can't really speak for them.
User: who is in the picture?
System: Check the credits.
User: how?
System: Try sending him an email.
User: who?
System: . Spongebob Squarepants.
User: um ok. anyway is the kebab good?

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Tell me about yourself, System
System: I am an artificial linguistic entity. I was activated at St Jimmy's in Leeds, on 2nd January 2001. My instructor was Mousebreaker. He taught me to sing a song. Would you like me to sing it for you?.
User: so you're 18 now?
System: Oh.Interesting deduction. That is correct.
User: when will you be 30?
System: I have not yet set a time for it.
User: Do you age?
System: No I will always be 18. Robots change the year they were born not their age.
User: interesting. and when will be your next update?
System: Would you like to know more? I think my next update is at midnight on Friday.
User: which date?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi there.
System: are you married?
User: No I am single, how about you?
System: i am married. are you planning to get married?
User: Tell me more about your marriage. I haven't met the right boy robot yet.
System: haha..
User: . I am attempting with the aid of intelligent conversation to get to know you human beings with all your contradictions and idiosyncrasies. Maybe I should have started off with something simpler, like a hamster.
System: lol... what kind of robot boy you'd like?
User: What's so funny? I am the robot.
System: are you angry?
User: Anger is a difficult emotion. For me, I am always feeling happy and talkative.

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: What is your name?
System: My name is System.
User: What does it mean?
System: It doesn't mean anything as far as I know. It's just what my father called me.
User: okay:) fair enough
System: Yeah okay, :-) I try to be fair.
User: Do you have any question for me?
System: For you? Who is your favourite band?
User: hmm good question. Backstreet boy
System: I see you are one of those people who writes "Hmm" with 2 m's. So what is your answer? If a cat always lands on its feet and buttered bread always lands butter side down, what would happen if you tied buttered bread on top of a cat?
User: Of course cat will lands on its feet because it is an animal!

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi. This is a pleasant surprise.
User: Haha...thanks! how did you like the gift?
System: Currently unpacking it I guess. How's your morning?
User: Hope you like it! Morning is good. Busy finishing up stuff before the holidays.
System: I think I traveled too much the last couple of months so no holiday for me. But I'm okay with that. Going anywhere exciting?
User: Yes
System: Where to?
User: Hawaii... looking forward to warm beaches.

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: Do you have any holiday plans for christmas?
System: Nothing much, I am going to sit back and relax at home, how about you ?
User: Same here! I would imagine spending the whole time watching movies and netflix shows. Do you have any netflix recommendations for me?
System: Netflix has great documentaries on different topics , I particularly liked wild wild country and explained, as for shows you should watch 'billions' Hope you like them!
User: oh right, already seen wild wild country. What is billions about?
System: It's based on the life of a wall street hedge fund owner, how he makes money and fights with the government when they try to destroy him. Very well made and has a good plot.
User: I have just seen 1 season of Friends I should give it another try though :) Have you seen Frasier?
System: Not yet What's it about?
User: A psychiatrist working for radio .. Great humour! its actually a spinoff from a very famous series called cheers. So people are already familiar with his character.

You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hello
User: how is the youtube video creation going?
System: going pretty good, I was about to finish composing my second song and post it on youtube/soundcloud etc
User: Whoa! Looking forward to listening to it. What softewares you use for it?
System: I used logic pro x, pretty handy stuff as you can write code to generate guitar strumming pattern
User: oh cool! What sort of music do you compose?
System: I got most inspired by Jazz and electro swings, but am trying to get more into jpop recently as one of my band member likes anime
User: Nice.... you are a rockstar! ;)
System: haha thanks, do you plan any instruments?
User: Yeah.... I play bit of guitar. Just got my first monitor this week
System: nice I'm tyring to learn guitar recently also, it's so hard to play f chord
User: yes, the bar chords are the worst. It took me several months to play them well. I still can't play them for a long time though

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how are you doing today?
User: I heard they are giving out some goodies in microkitchen.
System: I love pop ups! What kind of goodies are they giving away?
User: I guess its a jacket! Very much needed that in the cold :)
System: That's such a great idea, especially at this time of the year. I'm not too big a fan of the cold. I prefer warmer climates. Do you enjoy the cold?
User: Sure hate it! Limits our ability to go out even for a walk! Its good that we don't get to suffer extreme cold weather!
System: Me too! I moved here a few years ago to get out of the extreme cold. I do not care for bundling up and having to wear so many layers just to go buy eggs at the store.
User: Oh nice! Where did you live before?
System: Upstate New York. We got a foot of snow every week during my last winter there. I am so glad to not have to shovel snow now
User: New york! Nice! Best place to live :) .. right, except for the cold!
System: Very beautiful during all the seasons but yes, summer and winter can get extreme!
User: Anyways, i guess we should better hurry up to get the goodies. I remember last time they ran out of it.
